metadata.Title: CVE-2021-23997 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Due to unexpected data type conversions, a use-after-free could haveoccurred when interacting with the font cache. We presume that with enougheffort this could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 88.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23997` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 88.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
firefox-geckodriver - 88.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 88.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '88.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52 package in esm-infra/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
